intro: Sibbaldia ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous sibbaldia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sibbaldia ambigua is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in cold, nutrient-poor conditions.
